intro: Thunbergia robertii, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a climbing vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are often used in ornamental gardening. Thunbergia robertii prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun exposure.
